Class WQDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • WQDatabase

  • public class WQDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
    This class take cares of storing and serializing WQServer's persistent informations, such as users' nicknames and passwords, users' friend lists and users' scores. All the serialization is handled by the Gson external library.

      Constructors

      WQDatabase constructor.

      Inserts the user in the concurrent hash map if absent and returns true.

    • Method Detail

      • setScore

        public void setScore(java.lang.String nick,
                     int scoreVariation)
        Sets the user's score to the new value.
        Parameters:
        nick - the user's nickname.
        scoreVariation - the user's score variation.

      • insertUser

        public boolean insertUser(java.lang.String nick,
                          java.lang.String password)
        Inserts the user in the concurrent hash map if absent and returns true. it returns false if the nickname is already registered. Also serializes the database.
        Parameters:
        nick - the user's nickname.
        password - the user's password.
        Returns:
        true if the user has been added false otherwise.

      • addFriend

        protected boolean addFriend(java.lang.String nick,
                            java.lang.String friendNick)
        Adds a friend to the user's friendlist.
        Parameters:
        nick - user's nickname.
        friendNick - friend's nickname.
        Returns:
        true if the friend has been added false otherwise.

      • retrieveUser

        protected WQUser retrieveUser(java.lang.String nickname)
        Retrieves the user from the db and returns it to the caller.
        Parameters:
        nickname - user's nickname.
        Returns:
        the WQUser named nickname.

      • serialize

        protected java.lang.String serialize()
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Serialization method. Serializes WQDB on a .json file called Database.json
        Returns:
        a string containing WQDB for debug purposes only.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something strange happens with FileWriter while opening and writing the file.

      • deserialize

        protected void deserialize()
        Deserialization method. called on WQServer's startup.
